[1]: https://rosettacode.org/wiki/Left_factorials

# [Left factorials][1]

Built-in:

```ruby
say 20.of { .left_factorial }
```

Straightforward:

```ruby
func left_factorial(n) {
    ^n -> sum { _! }
}
```

Memory efficient with `Range.reduce()`:

```ruby
func left_factorial(n) {
    ^n -> reduce({ |a,b| a + b! }, 0)
}
```

A faster approach:

```ruby
func left_factorial(n) {
    static cached    = 0
    static factorial = 1
    static leftfact  = 0

    if (n < cached) {
        cached    = 0
        factorial = 1
        leftfact  = 0
    }

    while (n > cached) {
        leftfact  += factorial
        factorial *= ++cached
    }

    leftfact
}
```


Completing the task:

```ruby
for n in (0..10, 20..110 `by` 10) {
    printf("!%d  = %s\n", n, left_factorial(n))
}

for n in (1000..10000 `by` 1000) {
    printf("!%d has %d digits.\n", n, left_factorial(n).len)
}
```

#### Output:
```
!0  = 0
!1  = 1
!2  = 2
!3  = 4
!4  = 10
!5  = 34
!6  = 154
!7  = 874

!9  = 46234
```
